meanings.definition: A loud, high-pitched call used to attract attention or communicate over a distance.
meanings.sent1: The cooees of the lost child echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I heard a distant cooees and knew my friend was nearby.
meanings.sent3: The cooees of the excited fans filled the stadium.
meanings.sent4: Her cooees reached out like a beacon in the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The cooees of the hiker carried far across the valley.

meanings.definition: The act of making a cooee sound.
meanings.sent1: His cooees were so loud that they startled the birds.
meanings.sent2: The group practiced their cooees before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cooees of the children playing added to the joyful noise.
meanings.sent4: Her cooees were like music to my ears.
meanings.sent5: The cooees of the participants filled the room with energy.

meanings.definition: A shout or call used to locate someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The cooees of the lifeguard alerted everyone to the danger.
meanings.sent2: She let out a series of cooees to find her lost dog.
meanings.sent3: The cooees of the teacher brought the students back from recess.
meanings.sent4: His cooees pierced through the chaos of the marketplace.
meanings.sent5: The cooees of the search party echoed in the canyon.
